text: Alex Henderson is an English footballer who plays college soccer for Georgia State University. == College career == Ahead of the 2020 NCAA Division I men's soccer season, Henderson signed a National Letter of Intent to play college soccer for Georgia State University. He made his college soccer debut on 18 September 2020, playing 90 minutes in a 2–1 victory over Mercer University, contributing to one assist. Henderson was named to the TopDrawer Soccer Team of the Week for September 22. ==Club career== ===Ipswich Town=== Henderson made his first-team debut for the club on 4 December 2019, starting in a 1–1 away draw with Peterborough United in an EFL Trophy second round match, which Ipswich went on to win 5–6 on penalties. He was offered a one-year extension to his scholarship at the end of the 2019–20 season, however he turned the deal down in order to take up an offer for a place at Georgia State University in the United States. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |+Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|EFL Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |Ipswich Town |2019–20 |League One |0||0||0||0||0||0||1Appearance in EFL Trophy||0||1||0 |- |Bury Town (loan) |2019–20 |IL North Division |12||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||0||0||12||0 |- !colspan=3|Career total !12!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0!!13!!0 |} ==References== ==External links== * *Alex Henderson at Georgia State University Athletics Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Association football defenders Category:English footballers Category:Bury Town F.C. players Category:Georgia State Panthers men's soccer players Category:Ipswich Town F.C. players Category:Isthmian League players Category:English expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Expatriate soccer players in the United States
